massbalance

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • massbalance.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends Object

    This class contains static methods for parsing compound masses, writing graph information, and merging property files.

    The public methods can be called directly from the command line by executing java -jar massbalance.jar utilities [method] [args...], where method is the method name and args... are the method arguments.

    The following method arguments are supported and will be translated from the given string argument:

    MetabolicGraph: pass the file name of the deserialized object.
    int: pass the integer argument.
    String: pass the String argument.
    boolean: pass 'true' or 'false'.
    ArrayList<String>: pass a list of strings as ['String1','String2',...].

    An overview of the available methods is printed by executing the main class without arguments.

    Author:
    Georg Basler

      Searches the compounds from compoundsFile in the databaseFile by case-insensitive name and, if checkFormulas==true, by sum formula, and prints the compounds with deltaG to outputFile.
      static void appendDeltaGFromKEGG(String compoundsFile, String databaseFile, String outputFile)
      Searches a KEGG ID in compoundsFile, matches the compound in databaseFile and appends the deltaG and uncertainties to the compounds in outputFile.

      Appends the content from inputFile to the end of outputFile.

      Prints the number of single and double mass equivalence classes and their average sizes.

      Calculates the binomial coefficient (n over k).
      static void checkBalance(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Determines the mass-balance of the reactions in the given graph and prints unbalanced reactions.
      static void checkNetworks(String networkName, String inputDir, String randomization, int from, int to, String outputFile)
      Checks certain properties of the original network and the given range of randomized networks, e.g. the number of isolated compound nodes or the number of reactions containing a cycle.
      static void compoundAliasMap(String compoundsFile, String massesFile, String outputFile)
      Maps compound strings with their masses from 2 files: one contains the compound strings and aliases, the other maps the aliases to sum formulas.
      static void compoundMassesMap(String compoundsFile, String massesFile, String outputFile)
      Maps a list of compounds from compoundsFile to a list containing compound synonyms and masses in massesFile.
      static int countIsolatedNodes(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Counts the number of isolated nodes in the graph, i.e. nodes with an in-degree and out-degree of 0.
      static void countReactions(MetabolicGraph graph, boolean print)
      Counts the number of reactions, reversible, cyclic, zero-degree reactions, and the average and maximum reaction degrees.
      static void countReactionsWithCycles(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Counts the number of reactions which contain a cycle, i.e. a substrate which is also a product.

      Generates the tab-separated input files required for F2CA (Flux Coupling Analysis): 1.

      Creates a graph from the biocyc or flat file input directory and deserializes it to the output file name.

      Generates the input files required for F2CA from the original and randomized network files in the directory where networkFile is located.

      Generates the space-separated input files required for calculating the stoichiometric capacitance: 1.
      static void deltaGDifferences(String databaseFile, int hydrogenTolerance)
      Parses the sum formulas and deltaG values from the databaseFile and determines the differences in deltaGf between compounds which have an equal sum formula up to the specified hydrogenTolerance in the number of hydrogen atoms.
      static void findTransporters(MetabolicGraph graph, ArrayList<String> compoundNames, boolean exclusive)
      Finds and prints all transport reactions in which the given compounds are involved.

      Calculates the greatest common divisor the given values.

      Checks if there is SBML support, then validates and returns the SBMLDocument.
      static void joinLines(String inputFile1, String inputFile2, String outputFile)
      Searches in inputFile2 for the first string of each line in inputFile1, and joins the remaining strings in outputFile.
      static void joinSimilarSynonyms(String compoundsFile, String databaseFile, String outputFile, double maxDistance, int hydrogenTolerance)
      Parses the compounds file for synonyms (more than one name for a compound) and searches similar synonyms with similar sum formula in databaseFile.
      static void joinSynonyms(String inputMap, String databaseFile, String outputFile, boolean caseSensitive, int minMatch, int minAdd)
      Parses the inputMap file for synonyms (compound IDs and names) and searches all synonyms in databaseFile for exact matches.
      static long lcm(int x, int y)
      Returns the least common integer multiple for x and y, determined by dividing x*y by the greatest common divisors.

      Extracts protein complexes with gene regulatory from the BioCyc files for protein complexes (protcplxs.col), regulatory interatcions of all types (regulation.dat), and promoters (promoters.dat).
      static double parseCoefficient(String s)
      Parses a string and returns the stoichiometric coefficient, or -1 if the string is not a stoichiometric coefficient, i.e., a double number enclosed by DELIMITER_COEFFICIENT_START and DELIMITER_COEFFICIENT_END.
      static int[] parseInChIString(String name, String InChI, BufferedWriter infoWriter)
      Parses an InChI string and returns an int[ELEMENTS.length] containing the mass vector.
      static int[] parseMass(String massString, BufferedWriter infoWriter)
      Parses a string of format CXHYNZ..., where C,H,N are chemical elements followed by the number of atoms X,Y,Z.
      static ArrayList<String> parseTokens(String input, String delimiter, boolean lowercase)
      Parses the input string and returns a list of tokens separated by delimiter.
      static void printABCDPathway(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Prints a particular type of pathway, if present: A -> B+D B+D -> C where D is a cofactor (has a large degree), and B not.
      static void printCoefficients(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Prints the stoichiometric coefficients of the given graph, i.e., its edge weights.
      static void printCompartmentInfo(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Prints the number of compounds, reactions, and transporters associated with each compartment.
      static void printCompoundIndices(MetabolicGraph graph, ArrayList<String> compounds)
      Prints the indices in the sorted lists of compounds from the given compounds list.
      static void printDeadEndReactions(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Prints reactions with either in-degree or out-degree of zero.
      static void printEquivalenceClass(String classesFile, String compound)
      Prints the equivalence classes in which the given compound is contained.

      Prints the sorted stoichiometric matrix indices of all compounds in a compartment starting with "ext", "ex", or "e".

      Prints the number of compounds given by number with largest degree.
      static void printLargeCoefficients(MetabolicGraph graph, int min)
      Print all reactions in the given graph that have a coefficient at least as large as min.

      Maps the compound names given in indexFile to the pair of corresponding names given in mappingFile, and prints the indices of the mapped compounds in the sorted stoichiometric matrix.

      Prints all reaction equations of the given graph.

      Prints the reaction equations containing the specified compound.

      Prints all reactions with in-degree+out-degree < 3 in the graph.

      Prints reactions containing TCA cycle intermediaries from ecoli, satisfying additional conditions.
      static void reachable(MetabolicGraph graph, ArrayList<String> substrateNames, ArrayList<String> productNames, int includeHubs)
      Determines whether the given products are reachable (using the scope approach) from the given substrates, and if so, prints out the corresponding reactions on the path.

      Writes every tenth element from every line of the input file to the output file.
      static void summary(MetabolicGraph graph)
      Print the summary statistics for the given graph: - number of compounds and those containing only CHNOPS - number of reactions, unbalanced and unannotated reactions - reversibility of the graph, number of vertices and edges - sizes of connected and strongly connected components

      Prints all pathways starting at the given compound vertex until reaching the target compound (if specified) or the maximum depth of the pathway.

      Prints the molecular weights of all compounds in the given biocyc directory.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)

        The main method can be used to call the public methods of this class directly from the command line by executing
        java -jar massbalance.jar utilities [method] [args...]
        where method is the method name and args... are the method arguments. The following method arguments are supported and will be translated from the given string argument:

        MetabolicGraph: pass the file name of the deserialized object.
        int: pass the integer argument.
        String: pass the String argument.
        boolean: pass 'true' or 'false'.
        ArrayList<String>: pass a list of strings as ['String1','String2',...].

        An overview of the available methods is printed by executing the main class without arguments.

        Generates the input files required for F2CA from the original and randomized network files in the directory where networkFile is located.
        Parameters:
        dir - The relative input directory (C:\Temp\ is added).
        name - The network name.
        outputDir -
        Throws:
        IOException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • createFCAFiles

        public static void createFCAFiles(MetabolicGraph graph,
                  String outputDir,
                  String suffix)
                           throws IOException
        Generates the tab-separated input files required for F2CA (Flux Coupling Analysis): 1. Stoichiometric matrix S containing one columns for reversible reactions. 2. Reversibilities vector rev containing a 0 for irreversible, 1 for reversible reactions. 3. Reactions vector containing the reaction names. 4. Metabolites vector containing the metabolite names.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        graph -
        outputDir -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • testReversedDuplicates

        public static void testReversedDuplicates(MetabolicGraph graph)

      • createSCFiles

        public static void createSCFiles(MetabolicGraph graph,
                 String outputDir,
                 boolean reversible)
                          throws IOException
        Generates the space-separated input files required for calculating the stoichiometric capacitance: 1. Stoichiometric matrix S containing two columns for reversible reactions. 2. Mass matrix M containing mass vectors of chemical elements (rows) and compounds (columns). 3. Thermodynamic vector T containing the Standard Gibbs free energy of formation of compounds. 4. Compartment vector C containing the compartment number of compounds.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        outputDir -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • appendFile

        public static int appendFile(String inputFile,
             String outputFile)
                      throws IOException
        Appends the content from inputFile to the end of outputFile. Careful when applying to files with unfinished lines: remove the unfinished line before.
        Parameters:
        inputFile -
        outputFile -
        Returns:
        number of lines in the output file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • appendFiles

        public static void appendFiles(String firstInputFile,
               int numberOfFiles,
               String outputFile)
                        throws IOException
        Appends the content from inputFile and the next numberOfFiles-1 inputFiles with successive index numbers to the end of outputFile. E.g., "in.1.file 3 outFile" appends the contents of "in.1.file", "in.2.file", and "in.3.file", to "outFile". Index ranges are also supported if the file name contains a dash, e.g. "in.0-9.file 3 outFile" appends the contents of "in.0-9.file", "in.10-19.file", and "in.20-29.file" to "outFile". Careful when applying to files with unfinished lines: remove the unfinished line before.
        Parameters:
        firstInputFile -
        numberOfFiles -
        outputFile -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • appendColumns

        public static void appendColumns(String inputFile1,
                 String inputFile2,
                 String outputFile,
                 int offset)
                          throws IOException
        Appends the tab-separated tokens from each line in inputFile2 to the corresponding lines in inputFile1 and prints the resulting lines to outputFile. Lines starting with '#' are skipped. In addition, if offset<0, the inputFile1 is skipped by -offset lines, if offset>0, inputFile2 is skipped by offset lines.
        Parameters:
        inputFile1 -
        inputFile2 -
        outputFile -
        offset -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • mergeLines

        public static void mergeLines(String inputFile,
              String outputFile,
              int keyElements,
              ArrayList<String> mergeDelimiters)
                       throws IOException
        Searches the inputFile for multiple lines which start with the same key elements, and merges them onto one line. The remaining non-key elements (tab-separated) are checked for identity, and all non-identical elements are printed on the output line. Example: the two lines starting with 3 identical key elements: ackA01aceA# comment 1 ackA01rpsA# comment 2 are merged into one line: ackA01aceA;rpsA# comment 1. comment2. where keyElements==3, mergeDelimiters.get(0) is ";" and mergeDelimiters.get(1) is ". ".
        Parameters:
        inputFile -
        outputFile -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • printABCDPathway

        public static void printABCDPathway(MetabolicGraph graph)
        Prints a particular type of pathway, if present: A -> B+D B+D -> C where D is a cofactor (has a large degree), and B not.
        Parameters:

      • writeAllPathways

        public static void writeAllPathways(MetabolicGraph graph,
                    String compoundName,
                    String targetName,
                    int maxDepth,
                    String output,
                    boolean printMass,
                    boolean printDeltaG)
                             throws IOException
        Prints all pathways starting at the given compound vertex until reaching the target compound (if specified) or the maximum depth of the pathway. A pathway is defined as a path starting at the given vertex along the successor reactions and their primary products. A primary product is a product with number of C-atoms most similar to the preceeding pathway substrate. Each pathway step consists of a reaction or a set of compounds. Note that, if there are more than one primary product of a pathway step, and this is the last step of the pathway, then this pathway occurs multiple times. The specified maxDepth limits the pathway depth in order to avoid a combinatorial explosion.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        compoundName -
        targetname -
        maxDepth -
        targetName -
        output -
        printMass -
        printDeltaG -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeRootSCC

        public static void writeRootSCC(MetabolicGraph graph,
                String reactionsFile,
                String componentFile,
                boolean original)
                         throws IOException
        Writes all root-SCC (strongly connected components with no outgoing edges) to the specified files. Here, a root-SCC either has no outgoing edges, or all outgoing edges point to an external compound or reaction. In the first case, no steady-state solution is possible, and a warning is printed. Each line in the files corresponds to one root-SCC: in reactionsFile, each line contains the names of all reactions importing a compound into the root-SCC. In componentFile, each line contains the names of compounds and reactions in the root-SCC (one of each is a candidate sensor node). If original==true, then connections from a root-SCC to external nodes are allowed
        Parameters:
        graph -
        reactionsFile -
        componentFile -
        original -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • appendDeltaG

        public static void appendDeltaG(String compoundsFile,
                String databaseFile,
                String outputFile,
                boolean checkFormulas,
                int hydrogenTolerance)
                         throws IOException
        Searches the compounds from compoundsFile in the databaseFile by case-insensitive name and, if checkFormulas==true, by sum formula, and prints the compounds with deltaG to outputFile. A difference in hydrogen atoms is tolerated as specified by hydrogenTolerance. Used to append the deltaG values from the KEGG compounds to the compounds of a network.
        Parameters:
        compoundsFile - File containing compound names and, optionally, their sum formulas.
        databaseFile - File containing compound synonyms, sum formulas, and deltaG values.
        outputFile - Output file to print the found compound names, sum formulas, and deltaG values.
        checkFormulas - If true, the sum formla of a match is checked for equality up to the specified hydrogenTolerance. Otherwise, the sum formula is not checked.
        hydrogenTolerance - Number of hydrogen atoms which are allowed to differ for a matching compound.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • appendDeltaGFromKEGG

        public static void appendDeltaGFromKEGG(String compoundsFile,
                        String databaseFile,
                        String outputFile)
                                 throws IOException
        Searches a KEGG ID in compoundsFile, matches the compound in databaseFile and appends the deltaG and uncertainties to the compounds in outputFile. Used to append the deltaG values from the KEGG compounds to the compounds file of a network, matching by ID.
        Parameters:
        compoundsFile -
        databaseFile -
        outputFile -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deltaGDifferences

        public static void deltaGDifferences(String databaseFile,
                     int hydrogenTolerance)
                              throws IOException
        Parses the sum formulas and deltaG values from the databaseFile and determines the differences in deltaGf between compounds which have an equal sum formula up to the specified hydrogenTolerance in the number of hydrogen atoms.
        Parameters:
        databaseFile -
        hydrogenTolerance -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • joinSynonyms

        public static void joinSynonyms(String inputMap,
                String databaseFile,
                String outputFile,
                boolean caseSensitive,
                int minMatch,
                int minAdd)
                         throws IOException
        Parses the inputMap file for synonyms (compound IDs and names) and searches all synonyms in databaseFile for exact matches. If a synonym matches, the database line is appended by the name from inputMap and written to outputFile. Used to add new compound synonyms from a mapping file of a network to the database, which can then be used by appendDeltaG to add the deltaG values to the compounds list. First, the synonyms from the inputMap are parsed and stored row by row in a set of sets. Whitespaces are removed from each synonym. Next, the databaseFile is parsed, and each token (except those with '=' as second character) is compared to the synonyms after removing any whitespaces. Only if a synonym matches exactly with a token (except for whitespaces), the other synonym from the map (ID or name) is added to the database line and printed to outputFile. Example: inputMap: file containing compound IDs and their names: glcGlucose... databaseFile: file containing KEGG compound IDs, synonyms, and other values: C00031D-GlucoseGlucoseF=C6H12O6... caseSensitive: false minMatch: 2 minAdd: 2 This will create a line C00031glcD-GlucoseGlucoseF=C6H12O6... in the output file.
        Parameters:
        inputMap - The file containing at least two synonyms of compounds, usually an identifier and a compound name.
        databaseFile - File containing synonyms and additional information, such as sum formulas and deltaG values.
        caseSensitive - If true, synonyms are matched only case sensitive, otherwise case insensitive.
        minMatch - Minimum length of a matching string.
        minAdd - Minimum length of a synonym from a match to be added to the database line.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • joinSimilarSynonyms

        public static void joinSimilarSynonyms(String compoundsFile,
                       String databaseFile,
                       String outputFile,
                       double maxDistance,
                       int hydrogenTolerance)
                                throws IOException
        Parses the compounds file for synonyms (more than one name for a compound) and searches similar synonyms with similar sum formula in databaseFile. The names and sum formulas of the compounds file are collected, and then compared with the names and sum formulas in the database file. The distance between names from the compounds file and names from the database file is determined by the edit distance (Levenshtein distance) divided by the length of the larger name. If the distance is below maxDistance, and the sum formulas equal up to a difference of the number of hydrogen atoms specified by hydrogenTolerance, then all synonyms of the compound are added to the corresponding line in the database file. The output is written to outputFile. Used to add new compound synonyms from a compounds file of a network to a KEGG database file with synonyms, which can then be used by appendDeltaG to add the deltaG values to the compounds.
        Parameters:
        compoundsFile -
        databaseFile -
        outputFile -
        maxDistance -
        hydrogenTolerance -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • parseBioCycComplexes

        public static void parseBioCycComplexes(String complexesFile,
                        String regulationFile,
                        String promotersFile,
                        String outputFile)
                                 throws IOException
        Extracts protein complexes with gene regulatory from the BioCyc files for protein complexes (protcplxs.col), regulatory interatcions of all types (regulation.dat), and promoters (promoters.dat). Promoters are mapped to regulatory targets by mapping COMMON-NAME from the promoters file to REGULATED-ENTITY from the regulation file. The regulatory targets are mapped to their regulating protein complexes by mapping REGULATOR from the regulation file to the ID (first element of a line) in the protein complex file. Information on the gene products is extracted from the protein complex file.
        Parameters:
        complexesFile -
        regulationFile -
        promotersFile -
        outputFile -
        Throws:
        IOException

             ArrayList<String> productNames,

      • initSBML

        public static org.sbml.libsbml.SBMLDocument initSBML(String sbmlFile)
        Checks if there is SBML support, then validates and returns the SBMLDocument. Terminates if there is no SBML support, or if the document contains fatal errors (see validateSBML(SBMLDocument)). For some reason, the SBML Model is not stored properly as static variable. Therefore, we store the SBMLDocument, which avoids multiple validations.
        Parameters:
        sbmlFile -
        Returns:
        The SBMLDocument.
